titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs Records 1980-1998
Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs Records
titlestmt.author: Original author unknown

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Steven Bingo. 2009

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs records
did.abstract: This collection includes administrative files, published materials, and audio-visual media produced by the Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs. The Center was founded to encourage strong understanding and improved relations between the western United States and the nations of the Pacific Rim.
did.langmaterial: Materials in this records group are inEnglish

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs was founded in 1980 to encourage strong understanding and improved relations between the western United States and the nations of the Pacific Rim, in recognition of the outstanding work of Mike Mansfield in international relations in the Pacific. The Center was funded by the Mansfield Foundation and maintained offices at University of Montana's Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, in Washington, DC, and in Tokyo. It planned an administrative and conference facility on Flathead Lake in western Montana, but was unable to construct this facility. It sponsored the Mike Mansfield Fellowship program, publications, and symposia on contemporary issues, and focused programs on public affairs and commerce, the humanities, and the arts.

In 2003 the board of the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Foundation voted to change the name of the Mansfield Center for Public Affairs to the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Foundation, as the two operated as a single legal entity.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, financial records, and subject files that document the operations of the Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs from 1980-1996 as well as a few published materials detailing the history of the Center and its activities. In addition to the Center's administrative files, this collection also contains masters and copies of media produced by the Center. The audio-visual media contained in this collection include video and audio masters for a documentary about Asian immigrants in the western United States titled From the Far East to the Old West: Chinese and Japanese Settlers in Montana . The collection also includes audio recordings of oral histories and their corresponding transcripts, edit logs, photographs, and artwork. Copies of the oral history audio cassettes and the transcripts comprise Oral History collection 436.

arrangement.p: This collection is divided into two subgroups: Administrative Records and From the Far East to the Old West: Chinese and Japanese Settlers in Montana, production components.
Subgroup I, Administrative Records, consists of four series:
Series II: Financial Records, 1985-1989, four folders
Series III: Subject Files, 1980-1994, 2.1 linear feet
Subgroup II, From the Far East to the Old West: Chinese and Japanese Settlers in Montana, production components consists of four series:
Series I: Video and Audio Masters, undated, 3.5 linear feet
Series II: Oral History Interviews, audio cassettes, 1998 and undated, 0.2 linear feet
Series III: Edit logs and Oral History Transcripts, undated, 0.2 linear feet
Series IV: Production Artwork, Photographs, and Other Images, 1998 and undated, 1.2 linear feet

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Master material from Subgroup Two can only be used with permission from the Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs. Photo component use requires permission from the respective institutions.

prefercite.p: The Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs Records, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: The collection was in the possession of the Mansfield Center for Pacific Affairs until donation to the Archives.

acqinfo.p: Most of the administrative records were donated in 1991. The bulk of the production components for From the Far East to the Old West: Chinese and Japanese Settlers in Montana were donated in 2002 but the photos, zip disks and photo logs were donated in 2005.

processinfo.p: The actions taken to process this collection were unrecorded. Prior to 2017, copies of the the oral history transcripts and cassette tapes were created and are now part of Oral History Collection 436.
In 2018, a few published materials, subject files, and a financial report were added to this collection.

relatedmaterial.p: Archives and Special Collections also holds records for the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Foundation, RG 034.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence produced by the Center.

arrangement.p: The materials were arranged chronologically by subject.

scopecontent.p: This series contains materials published by the Center about its history and activities. Most relate to events hosted by the Center.

did.unittitle: From the Far East to the Old West: Chinese and Japanese Settlers in Montana, production components

scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include several audio-visual formats, including Beta and VHS videotapes, CDs, and DV video.
